reviews.sentence: Wonderful stay. Very friendly and helpful front Office reception Service. Hotel reception help with Reservation of several tours and dinner. Hotel within walking distance to the old town.
We experienced great hospitality amp a wonderful breakfast every morning.
Check in room service and bar were great. The breakfast buffet was good. However the room was too hot and I was unable to adjust temperature or open window for fresh air.

Enjoyed my stay. The hotel is extremely well located next to all the top attractions restaurants and the Palladium shopping mall. The rooms are clean with particular mention to the bathroom which was sparkling. This is very nice. The room itself. I had a superior room is fine. In line with 4 star standards. Free wifi. Robe slippers. Nice large size. Plus for ladies it has a vanity in the room so getting ready is easy. The bed was comfortable if you do not like medium to hard mattress then it will not be for you. Coffee tea facilities in the room just a kettle with tea and powdered coffee. There is only one room with Nespreso coffee facilities for those used to that at Acor facilities and that is the Deluxe room. Of course there is only ONE deluxe room in the entire hotel so the odds of getting it. Plenty of towels offered good and large in room safe. I have not sampled the food. Strong wifi and even picks up the wifi in the neighbouring hotel which is Ibis and belongs to the group. The couple negatives outside of the kettle in the room which is not a big deal the lifts are ridiculously slow which is not a game changer or a real problem and the hotel smells funny like cheap cologne. Not the rooms themselves but the halls and sometimes the reception area. Rooms do not all have very nice views mine had the backs of other buildings. Point of interest this building used to house the insurance firm at which Franz Kafka worked.

Fantastic Hotel in great location. could not have been happier with this hotel. Top class location close to everything with a shopping centre and supermarket right next door and a short easy walk to old town square. Wonderful service and our room was clean modern and very comfortable. The breakfast was tasty plentiful with lots of variety. Wonderful stay in a great hotel.

The staff were all very friendly and professional always helpful. The hotel was conveniently located the bed was of the excellent standard we expect from the Acor group and the breakfast was delicious and of outstanding quality. We loved the building of the hotel with the high ceilings but we thought the decor in our room was a little tired especially the carpet which needed replacing.

Good Location and Excellent Breakfast. The location was terrific for getting around Prague and had one of the local street car lines right in front did cause a bit of noise. It was close to supermarkets good restaurants and ATMs plus a short walk to many of the must see attractions. The room in which breakfast was served was charming with an open kitchen where you could see breakfast foods being cooked. The bar was charming albeit small and the lobby waiting area small but manageable. The only real disadvantage was disembarking from the airport with ones luggage as the street was very busy a streetcar line was running and one had to hop out of your vehicle quickly port your own luggage as the driver would not be able to leave his her vehicle and get into the hotel by yourself. Not a good choice if you are unable to move quickly and ably.

Great location nicely priced. We stayed at the Century in June when we visited Prague. The hotel is in a great location to explore Prague located in the Old town it is easy to walk to the main attractions. if not up to walking then trams and the Metro are within easy reach of the hotel also local is a large shopping complex where you can eat very cheaply however also many local restaurants to try as well. The rooms are good sized we had a shower instead of a bath in our room that was fine but after a long day walking and exploring Prague my partner wanted to relax her aching feet with a long soak. We had booked a room with breakfast breakfast was served downstairs and you could choose to eat inside or out food was good plenty to eat and a wide choice from cereals porridge breads and rolls fruit and hot cooked food such as sausages bacon mushrooms and egg. etcas well as tea coffee juices and smoothies. The entrance to the hotel is large with a nice bar area to the right. We arrived on Tuesday morning and as our room was not ready we left our bags with reception and went exploring on the day we left we had to check out by midday so again we left our bags with reception and returned in the evening when our transport arrived. We found the staff very friendly and gave advice on getting to different attractions we wanted to visit. The hotel was busy but we did not find it noisy the room was comfortable and as said in a great location for getting around and sightseeing in Prague. The hotel also has some history attached which you may enjoy looking into and reading about on the pictures hanging on the walls.

This hotel is perfectly situated for everything that you want to see in Prague. The room is a bit tired looking decor wise but perfectly comfortable. The breakfast is excellent with all needs catered for.
Clean and close to the city center Welcoming staff Very diverse breakfast.

A very pleasant stay. Upon arrival at the Century Old Town we were told that our room was unavailable for the first night. In recompense we were offered the following the first nights stay in the Ibis hotel next door the following two nights of our stay would be in the Century Old town with an upgrade to deluxe rooms free transportation to the train station when we checked out. We were also given a voucher for a free drink at the hotel bar. All of this was honored. I must say the staff were exceedingly friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The deluxe rooms were very nice indeed. Wifi was free the bed was comfortable and the pillows actually had some substance to them. The room was quiet. Breakfast was just fine where there was pretty much everything you might want to eat on offer. The hotel is centrally located not far from Namesti Republicky station and the Municipal House. One could actually walk from the main station since it is a pretty short gently downhill distance. It is on a busy street but as I have mentioned it is very quiet inside. I can highly recommend the Century Old Town and for that matter I can also recommend the Ibis Old Town hotel next door.

Fantastic location walking distance to the centre of Prague. I came here with my father and my brother and we were not disappointed. The hotel is ideally placed to many tourist locations in Prague. Wenceslas Square the Astronomical clock and the old town square are just 5 10 minutes walk. There is also a tram stop outside the hotel as well as the metro which is a few minutes away. The rooms vary in size but we all had reasonably large rooms which were very comfortable with modern bathrooms and good showers. Breakfast was plentiful with a wide choice of both hot and cold foods. At times this was very busy but the wait was not too long. Hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful. They would give advice on places to eat as well as book taxis. Check out a great restaurant called La Republica just opposite the hotel. I would recommend this hotel if you want good accommodation which is central to old Prague.

Great hotel. Very helpful friendly staff. Very big room with queen size bed. Close to old town square. I am gluten free was worried about breakfast. But no worries breakfast was great. Fresh gluten free bread every morning. After the first morning they had the breakfast ready for me everyday at the time I wanted it. The breakfast buffet was very good plenty full.

Excellent hotel. Great location. At the time of our visit the hotel was being remodeled second third floor but it did not disturb our stay in any way. The room is nicely decorated very clean lines and pleasant atmosphere as you would feel a guest room in a friends house. We got a ground level room so we had a small terrace opposite the in property restaurant. Loved it. The complimentary toiletries include slippers and bath towel. The room has a small desk with an electric teapot and a variety of tea and coffee decaf included. We stayed three nights and wished we could stay longer. The bathroom had a towel heater 2 C outside that you can turn on easily during your shower and turn off when you are done. PSThe bedding is absolute bliss.

Below expectation. Welcome fruits were wizened. Welcome cake was old dry and inedible. Welcome postcard had someone elses name. The restaurant was closed which I found shocking as it was supposed to be open Monday through Sunday according to the hotel website. The bar did not have cabernet even though it was on the bar menu.

Very happy with the room and with the friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff. My only complaints and the reason I did not give a higher rating are the lack of a fitness centre and the high cost of breakfast.

Nice hotel and very nice rooms but hotel personel runs away when there is a problem. Stayed several times in this nicely located hotel. Good service and nicely refurbished rooms. The renovated bar makes it even more attractive. The water supply got interrupted and the water colored brown that morning. The personel did nothing else than running away from their responsibility to warn the guest. No warning no explanation. no bottled water supply. It was most probably not their fault but they should have communicated this pro actively and openly and help the customers. Not negating is. BTW got 2 days sick after it. intestinal disorder Can be a pure coincidence but this looks me highly unlikely.

A half baked hotel with potential. I stayed two nights at the Century Old Town and left with mixed feelings. On the surface it is a very nice hotel very well situated. But like they say the devil is in the detail. Where to start. Many reviewers complain about the poor A C system and I can confirm that it is a bit odd indeed. We stayed in one of the meeting rooms and had to call someone to change the temperature every time it got too warm or too coldThe hotel has been refurbished in the last years to give it a modern look. that is fine by me but then do it properly please. While the hotel has a distinctive modern style it has kept some remnants of his previous glory. such as the super kitschy 80s90s golden elevator. The decorator must have forgotten about it. it is also excruciatingly slowthat is a detail but something else annoyed me a bit more. The stylish bathroom does not have space for personal items and the shower is completely open. There is no wall curtain or anything to contain the water. That means that after a shower the floor will be wet and it will stay wet for a while. I do not know what you supposed to do if you want to go back to the bathroom after you got dressed. Sorry that is not the best idea for a bathroom. The bed was very comfortable but the view which I normally would not care too much about was not exciting see picture. If I was the hotel I would pay the neighbor and get that wall painted. As the other picture shows the window itself was falling apart. Breakfast was fine. The juices are kept in a fridge for some reason. That means that you need both hands to open the door get the bottle remove the cap etc. not great when you are holding a plate of food. A juice dispenser that is easy to reach and operate would be better. Eventually that hotel has lot of potential but needs to fix a few things before it fully deserves 4 stars.

Nice hotel but poor service delivery. Room was small but was nicely furnished and comfortable. Bar was great we liked Samy a lot he was a good bar tender. We had a drink in the bar most evenings. We were asked to pay for breakfast on day 4 but we refused and the matter was quickly sorted out. On day 3 they took away our dustbin we eventually got it back on day 4 after about 2 attempts. The evening before check out we requested a taxi to the airport and for it to be charged to our room. The taxi was booked but it was not charged. Wake up call was requested for both our rooms but we did not get a call. A packed breakfast was offered but not delivered at check out. We were billed for orange juice taken from the mini bar but we did not have anything from the minibar. In the end it was all sorted out but it left the feeling that the hotel had poor service delivery. We normally stay at Sofitel properties but unfortunately there was not one in Prague. Whilst the property is very well placed it is very unlikely that I would stay here again.

Ideally located for a city trip small rooms but good breakfast. Location of hotel is good ideally situated between bus train station and old town next to shopping centres. Breakfast was good too and offered a large selection. We especially liked the local specialities eg buchty the freshly prepared omelettes and the fresh juices. Only slight complaint is that our coffee order was forgotten 2 times but we were able to help ourselves. The room was clean and nicely furnitured however it was quite small and especially lacked storage possibilities. Even if it was OK for the 3 nights I would definitely look for a larger room for longer stays in order to store clothes etc. The bar keeper did a great job too and mixed two tasty drinks. In general we perceived the staff to be very friendly. If the price is right we would definitely choose your hotel again.

Fantastic Hotel. We visited Prague during December for the Christmas markets and could n’t be happier with our stay. The staff was so wonderful and accommodating. We were granted early check in on arrival and upgraded to a large executive suite with both a super cozy king sized bed and a pull out sofa which was perfect for two girlfriends traveling together. The bar downstairs was a small and intimate lounge that was perfect for an after a long day cocktail at very reasonable prices not to mention the daily afternoon happy hour. The location was great. We were able to easily walk to the nearby Old Town Square home of the infamous Astronomical Clock and Christmas markets as well as the Charles Bridge and Prague Castle a little bit of a jaunt but doable if you like to get your steps in and do n’t mind the incline up to the castle. On the nearby streets we stumbled upon lots of cute boutique shops as we made our way to the tourist attractions. There is also a grocery store in the Palladian shopping mall next door which was great for water and snacks.

Great location. Nice and beautiful hotel. The location is really good and you can walk almost everywhere in Prague from there. The rooms are ok. Breakfast is very good. Chef there make omelette. Service from the young waiters are really good. The bar is nice but different attitude from bartender. Think we will stay here again.
